holidays.name: International Moment of Laughter Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to stopping whatever you‚Äôre doing to share a spontaneous moment of laughter with friends, family, or even strangers. Laughter is the best medicine after all!
holidays.origin: Started in the late 20th century by humor enthusiasts aiming to promote happiness and social bonding.
holidays.funFact: Scientists have found that laughter can boost your immune system and reduce stress hormones.

holidays.name: Look up at the Sky Day
holidays.description: An observance encouraging everyone to take a break from screens and daily stress by simply looking up and appreciating the sky above, whether it's sunny, cloudy, starry, or stormy.
holidays.origin: Began as a social media movement promoting mindfulness and natural beauty appreciation.
holidays.funFact: Looking at the sky can help relax your mind and improve your mood instantly.

holidays.name: Pan American Day
holidays.description: Commemorates the first international conference held in 1889 to promote cooperation among countries in the Americas. It celebrates unity, cultural exchange, and friendship across the continents.
holidays.origin: Established by the Pan American Union, the forerunner of the Organization of American States (OAS).
holidays.funFact: Pan American Day is celebrated only in some parts of Central and South America, and even the USA observes Peace Officers Memorial Day on the same date.

holidays.name: Ex-Spouse Day
holidays.description: A quirky unofficial holiday reminding people to appreciate the lessons learned from ex-partners ‚Äî and perhaps send a kind message to those former flames who helped shape their lives.
holidays.origin: Created by online communities poking fun at relationships and encouraging forgiveness and closure.
holidays.funFact: Some people use the day to send humorous or sincere messages to their exes; others just take it as a moment of personal reflection.
